intro: Sophora genistifolia, commonly known as the Chinese wisteria, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are pinnate and consist of 10–20 pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in clusters, typically in late spring, which are pale blue to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. However, it can become invasive in certain regions if not properly managed.
